subject: Science
title: Series and Parallel Circuits
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Series and Parallel Circuits.

hook.text: Old Christmas lights had a fatal flaw: one bulb burns out and the entire string goes dark.

buildup.text: Those lights were wired in series â€” one path for current, so every bulb must work.

discovery.text: Parallel circuits give each device its own path. If one fails, the others keep running.

twist.text: Your house is wired in parallel. That's why one blown light doesn't kill every outlet.

climax.text: Series splits voltage. Parallel splits current. Engineers mix both for different needs.

punchline.text: Series: one shared path. Parallel: independent paths. Your house picks parallel.

quiz.question: Why are homes wired with parallel circuits?
options: Each device works independently if another fails
